newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Benguet Q1 loss at 162.5 mln pesos.
newsitem.headline: Benguet Q1 loss at 162.5 mln pesos.

text.p: Benguet Corp said on Monday it posted a net loss of 162.5 million pesos in the firstuar of the year compared with a loss of 16.0 million in the same period last year.
The country's oldest mining company said the loss per share was 1.42 pesos from a loss of 14 centavos registered a year ago.
It said in a statement its revenues from operations dropped to 526.5 million pesos in the first quarter compared with 783.9 million in the same period last year.
Benguet attributed its losses to the decline in metal prices and production.
Its Dizon copper-gold operation posted a loss of 48.7 million pesos in the first three months compared to net earnings of 31.7 million in the year-ago period.
Benguet'a Antamok gold operation also suffered a net loss of 72.8 million pesos or nearly twice its loss of 32.7 million in first quarter 1996.
Early this year, Benguet secured a one-year debt moratorium on principal payments worth 944 million pesos, a senior official told reporters last week.
Officials had said the company hope to get an additional $85 million next year to pay off its debts.

The money is expected to come from Echo Bay Mines and TVI Pacific Inc when they exercise their option to develop the Kingking copper and gold mine in Pantukan, Davao del Norte province in southern Philippines.
Benguet said it expected its Dizon copper-gold operation to turn around in the second half of the year.
It also expected cash flow on its Benguet mine to improve in the fourth quarter of the year.
